meanings.definition: In a manner that cannot be attacked or questioned
meanings.sent1: She defended her position unassailably during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The evidence supported his claim unassailably.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat unassailably on top of the highest shelf, out of reach.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty to his friends was unassailably strong, like a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood unassailably tall against the backdrop of the sky.

meanings.definition: In a way that is beyond doubt or dispute
meanings.sent1: The facts presented unassailably proved his innocence.
meanings.sent2: Her talent in painting was unassailably recognized by all.
meanings.sent3: The cookie jar was unassailably empty, much to the disappointment of the kids.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose unassailably every morning, painting the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: His kindness shone unassailably bright in a world full of darkness.
